climbs.name: Zyzzyx
climbs.fa: SCMA with Ben Chapman & Pam Neal (July 2016)

content.description: Just right of the bulging black south face of the base of Trapper Dome is a right trending ramp. Step up on the ramp to access crimps in the crease below a flake feature near the top of the wall. Once established on the face, work up a series of three left trending ramps while meandering left and right to connect features on the face. Ramps, incut edges, sidepulls, crimps, flakes, and an undercling lead to the aforementioned flake feature. Work up the flake or "walk the plank" to a final mantle to the anchor at the top. Deservedly popular due to the moderate grade, excellent protection, fun movement, and short approach, Zyzzyx received 33 TR ascents and 4 leads in its first 24 hrs.
content.location: Forty feet right of Eight Thousand Foot Headrush. Directly below the giant pine tree at the top of the slab at the PLAYGROUND (Upper Tier). Zyzzyx is in the middle of the south face at the base of Trapper Dome.

content.description: The crux comes right off the ground to and past the first bolt, climb past one more bolt to fun crack to 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: This route is to the right of The Stroll.

content.description: Starts via standing on some decaying tree trunks.  Work your way up a short flake to the first bolt and do a highstep mantle to land your feet on top of the flake.  The next move involves another, but easier mantle to access the second bolt which protects the upcoming crux.  A couple of face moves from here leads one to easier climbing and the rap/lower bolts.  Fun and well protected.
content.location: About halfway accross the skirt of the lower tier, on the right side of a steep gully/wide crack with a fallen tree trunk in it.

content.description: The Kroll guide says 5.9, but even on TR this thing is a beast. I would venture it goes around 5.10+. The crux is getting all the way to the original route crack. There is a lot of vegetation in the thin undercling crack but room for tips just where you need it. Lead would be bold.
content.location: Single shiny new bolt on the face to the left of the Republicans on Crack regular start

content.description:
A retrobolted trad climb, A fine steep route on the lower tier of Trapper Dome. Powerful moves up a well protected corner. Stem and grunt your way to the crux near the top

For the real challenge, try leading it like the FA did, on gear!
content.protection: 6 bolts. Anchor on big pine tree
content.location: Locate a obvious bolted corner, just past a large fallen tree,

content.description: A quick route up a water streak.
content.location: Lower tier. 2 obvious bolts on this slab next to a black streak.
